subject: Sales
title: The Zone of Possible Agreement
description: A quick win: understand The Zone of Possible Agreement.

hook.text: You'll pay up to $300,000 for a house. The seller won't take under $270,000. That $30,000 gap is gold.

buildup.text: The ZOPA is the overlap between what you'll accept and what the other side will accept.

discovery.text: If no overlap exists, no deal is possible. Smart negotiators figure out the ZOPA before the first offer.

twist.text: Neither side reveals their limits. The ZOPA is always a guess until someone blinks.

climax.text: Expand the ZOPA by adding new terms: timing, extras, flexibility. Don't just haggle on price.

punchline.text: Find the overlap. That's where every deal lives.

quiz.question: What is the ZOPA in a negotiation?
options: The total value of the deal
The overlap where both sides can agree
